Description: Body sherd of Attic black-figured pottery open vessel, possibly a kantharos; interior black with band in added red; exterior: black-figure decoration consisting of Aphrodite holding Eros: at right, part of Aphrodite’s peplos and mantle (red with added white rosettes and white-dotted vertical borders on mantle; incised diamond pattern with crosses on peplos) with legs and heels of Eros, to right; at left, part of undetermined black-figure motif; inscription beside Aphrodite.
Curator's comments: See also Hirayama, H. 2010 Kleitias and Attic Black-figure Vases in the Sixth Century B.C., 60, C7, pl. 37f.
Bibliographic references: Vase / Catalogue of Vases in the British Museum (B601.17)
Beazley & Payne 1929 / Attic Black Figured Fragments from Naukratis (p. 262-3, no. 32)
Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 355, no. B452)
Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (p. 230, no. 1)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0738) (Phase 1)
